hours_text:
# LOCATION AND CONTACT INFO:

### Contacting us is easy!

**Mailing Address:**

202 E 6th Street, Bloomington, IN 47408

**Phone Number:** 812.332.2517

**Entrance:** Visitor entrance is handicap accessible and located on the west side of the building off of Washington Street (across from Baked!) 

# DIRECTIONS:

### Getting to the Monroe County History Center is easy!

Our street address is 202 E 6th Street. We are in the heart of downtown Bloomington, the MCHC property is located on the corner of Sixth and Washington Streets, one block east of the courthouse square. 

Although our address is listed for 6th street, our entrance is handicap accessible and is located on the west side of the building off of Washington Street (across from Baked!) 

# HOURS:

Tuesday – Saturday 10:00 am until 4:00 pm.

**Please note we will be closed the week of Monday, January 5th through Friday, January 9th. We will reopen on Saturday, January 10th with regular hours and Saturday’s Child.**

# HOLIDAY HOURS:

**Christmas Eve:** Open 10 am until 2 pm

**New Years Eve:** Open 10 am until 2 pm

We are closed the following holidays: New Year’s Day, Martin Luther King, Jr. Day, Memorial Day, Juneteenth, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, Christmas. 

Research Library is by [appointment only](mailto:library@monroehistory.org).

# PARKING:

Metered parking is available throughout the downtown area and on both Washington and Sixth Streets directly in front of the MCHC or in the lot directly to ...

collections_text:
# OUR COMMITMENT

We began from humble roots, a band of citizens who cared about the past and wanted to ensure future generations would know how our community came to be. From the collections we secure, to the artifacts we display, even our building has a story. Come visit and you’ll see why we LIVE, LOVE AND SHARE HISTORY!

# _ON DISPLAY_

Transportation History | Hey Neighbor! Historical Bloomington Neighborhoods | 1830s Pioneer Life  
---|---|---  
Limestone Industry | Life with Lanterns | 1880s School House  
Monroe County Sports | Seward Ironworks Company | Monroe County Military  
  
# _EXHIBITS_

**  
We Love to Share History!  
Come and visit our galleries,  
there’s always a surprise to be discovered.**

[](https://monroehistory.org/exhibit-galleries/)

[](https://monroehistory.org/first-floor-exhibits/)

[](https://monroehistory.org/exhibit-galleries/)

[](https://monroehistory.org/online-exhibits/)
